intro: Bastardia foetida, commonly known as stinking sprangletop, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its upright, branched stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in summer, and its leaves are typically narrow and grass-like. Bastardia foetida is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It is also known for its strong, unpleasant odor, which is most noticeable when the flowers are in bloom.
